alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; White Mountains; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued June 26 at 8:01PM MST until June 28 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM MST TUESDAY FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR MUCH OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... * AFFECTED AREA...Locations near Alpine, Payson, Pine- Strawberry, Pinetop-Lakeside, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Sedona, Seligman, Show Low and Whiteriver. This includes portions of the Apache- Sitgreaves National Forest, Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest, Prescott National Forest and Tonto National Forest. * WINDS...For Tuesday and Wednesday, south to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For Tuesday and Wednesday, as low as 6 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring or are imminent. A combination of strong winds and low relative humidities can contribute to extreme fire behavior. Please notify field crews of this Red Flag Warning. Avoid outdoor activities that can cause a spark near dry vegetation, such as yard work, target shooting, or campfires. Follow local fire restrictions. Check weather.gov/flagstaff for updates and livingwithfire.info for preparedness tips. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. Please notify field crews of this Fire Weather Watch.
